title: Ball wins $489.6 million contract to deliver next-generation weather satellite sounder
summary: Ball Aerospace won a $486.9 million contract to deliver a sounder for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Geostationary Extended Observations satellite program.

title: Direct-to-device: a $100-billion question
summary: Given the number of people who lack reliable terrestrial network connectivity, the addressable market is worth “$100 billion or even more,” according to Euroconsult.

title: NASA Selects Ball Aerospace to Develop NOAA’s GeoXO Sounder Instrument
summary: NASA, on behalf of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), selected Ball Aerospace & Technologies Corporation of Boulder, to develop the sounder instrument for a Geostationary Extended Observations (GeoXO) satellite program.

title: Thaicom picks Airbus to build Eutelsat-backed GEO satellite for Asia
summary: Thaicom has picked Airbus to deliver an Asia-focused spacecraft in 2027, putting the manufacturer ahead of the pack for geostationary communications satellite wins so far this year after leaving 2022 empty-handed.

title: NASA Leadership to Call Agency’s Record-Breaking Astronaut in Space
summary: During an Earth-to-Space call at 12:05 p.m. EDT Wednesday, Sept. 13, NASA Administrator Bill Nelson and Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy will speak with agency astronaut Frank Rubio about his record-breaking mission aboard the International Space Station.
